Authors: Ramadanty S., Safitri Y., Suhendra H.
Title: Social media content strategy for higher education, Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ramadanty, S., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Safitri, Y., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suhendra, H., Bina Nusantara University, Faculty of Economics Communication, Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The inevitable presence of social media changes the process of recruiting prospective students to higher education institutions (HEIs). Content strategies are part of social media strategies to convey information to alumni, current students, and prospects. This research aims to delve deeper into social media strategies that focus on content, through Facebook and Instagram, used by higher education in Indonesia. Content analysis is used to analyze research units based on predetermined categories in type, timing, and content format. The data collection period determined for 1 (one) year from 1 April 2019 to 31 March 2020. The results of this research are dominated by video content type, event content categories and the timing for post time at the noon. Overwise, determine the content strategy, HEIs are advised to align the objectives of social media strategy, and select appropriate social media channels to an effectiveness of social media content strategy for higher education. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Content strategy; Facebook; Higher education; Instagram; Social media strategy
Index Keywords: Information management; Students; Content analysis; Data collection; Facebook; Higher education; Higher education institutions (HEIs); Indonesia; Social media; Video contents; Social networking (online)

Title: Social Media Influencers Involvement in the Digital Campaign in Indonesia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Marketing Communication Program Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ramadanty, S., Marketing Communication Program Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Safitri, Y., Marketing Communication Program Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Social Media Influencers involvement become a separate phenomenon in digital marketing activity carried out by brands in Indonesia, especially to attract consumer awareness. This study aims to explore the process of communication involving the involvement of Social Media Influencers in digital marketing campaign activities in Indonesia. The research method used is qualitative by conducting an In-Depth interview with 10 informants that work as brand communication or practitioner in the PR Agency whoever involved Social Media Influencers in their digital marketing campaign activities. This research used three phases of data analysis according to Miles and Huberman: Reduction Data, Display Data, and Conclusion Drawing. The results show that in the communication process of Social Media Influencers in the campaign of digital marketing activities are as a medium or channel to inform campaign messages and their role is to reach awareness, engagement and expecting to the purchase intention of the audience. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: campaign; digital marketing; social media influencer
Index Keywords: Commerce; Information management; Marketing; Social networking (online); campaign; Communication process; Consumer awareness; Digital marketing; In-depth interviews; Purchase intention; research methods; Social media; Economic and social effects

Title: Customer Experience Bali Natural Beauty Care Through Social Media
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Evelina, L.W., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Safitri, Y., Marketing Communication Program, Communication Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Sensatia Botanicals is one of the herbal cosmetics brands based in Bali that uses social media in digital marketing strategies as an effort to win the market. This study wants to describe customer experience when interacting with brands through testimonials published on customer social media accounts. This study used a qualitative approach with a netnography method. The research subject of Sensatia Botanicals and object research of customer experience models will be prepared in three stages, namely Customer Touchpoint, Moment of Truth and Customer Involvement. The results of this study show that customer touchpoints put more emphasis on social media Instagram and YouTube. Moment of Truth is based on customer testimonials, the majority of which are positive sentiments. Customer Engagement through views, likes, and comments providing education to customers about product use, knowing raw materials and manufacturing processes. This study contributes to the world of marketing by utilizing social media technology, while academically inspiring customer experience by monitoring public sentiment on social media. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: beauty care; customer experience; social media
Index Keywords: Commerce; Information management; Social networking (online); Beauty care; Customer experience; Customer testimonials; Manufacturing process; Public sentiments; Qualitative approach; Research subjects; Social media; Sales
